What is meningitis, and what should I do?
Meningitis is an inflammation of the protective membranes surrounding your brain and spinal cord. You need to go to the hospital as soon as possible!
What causes meningitis, Medi?
Meningitis can be caused by bacteria or viruses. The symptoms can be severe, so prompt diagnosis and treatment are crucial.
What are the treatment options?
The treatment will depend on the cause of meningitis. Antibiotics or antiviral medication may be used.
Thanks for your help, Medi. What should I do to prevent meningitis from happening again?
knowledge: Meningitis Meningitis  For instance, in the United Kingdom, empirical treatment consists of a third-generation cefalosporin such as cefotaxime or ceftriaxone.  In the US, where resistance to cefalosporins is increasingly found in streptococci, addition of vancomycin to the initial treatment is recommended.  Chloramphenicol, either alone or in combination with ampicillin, however, appears to work equally well. Empirical therapy may be chosen on the basis of the person's age, whether the infection was preceded by a head injury, whether the person has undergone recent neurosurgery and whether or not a cerebral shunt is present.  In young children and those over 50 years of age, as well as those who are immunocompromised, the addition of ampicillin is recommended to cover Listeria monocytogenes.  Once the Gram stain results become available, and the broad type of bacterial cause is known, it may be possible to change the antibiotics to those likely to deal with the presumed group of pathogens.  The results of the CSF culture generally take longer to become available  Meningitis Meningitis
response: You should take precautions such as washing your hands regularly and avoiding close contact with people who have meningitis.
